mjhv.shapes

Class Sphere

  • java.lang.Object
    • mjhv.shapes.Sphere

  • public class Sphere
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a 3-Dimensional Sphere
    Version:
    9/25/2016
    Author:
    mvalenciano825

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Sphere()
      This constructor creates a default instance of a Sphere and sets all dimensions to zero
      Sphere(double radius)
      This constructor creates a new instance of a Sphere with a radius
      Sphere(double x, double y, double z, double radius)
      This constructor creates a new instance of a Sphere with x, y, and z coordinates and a radius

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double calcSurfaceArea()
      This method calculates the surface area of the sphere object
      double calcVolume()
      This method calculates the volume of the sphere
      void draw(processing.core.PApplet drawer)
      This method draws a new instance of a Sphere object
      void grow(double factor)
      This method increases or decreases the radius of the sphere by a growth factor
      boolean isPointInSphere(double x, double y)
      This method tests to see if a point is inside the sphere object and returns true if it is and false if the specified point is not within the sphere
      void move(double x, double y)
      This method moves the sphere to the x, y, and z coordinates that are passed in.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Sphere

        public Sphere()
        This constructor creates a default instance of a Sphere and sets all dimensions to zero

      • Sphere

        public Sphere(double x,
              double y,
              double z,
              double radius)
        This constructor creates a new instance of a Sphere with x, y, and z coordinates and a radius
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate of the sphere's center
        y - y-coordinate of the sphere's center
        z - z-coordinate of the sphere's center
        radius - length of the sphere's radius

      • Sphere

        public Sphere(double radius)
        This constructor creates a new instance of a Sphere with a radius
        Parameters:
        radius - length of sphere's radius

    • Method Detail

      • move

        public void move(double x,
                 double y)
        This method moves the sphere to the x, y, and z coordinates that are passed in. These coordinates must be positive
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate of new point
        y - y-coordinate of new point

      • calcSurfaceArea

        public double calcSurfaceArea()
        This method calculates the surface area of the sphere object
        Returns:
        double of calculated surface area

      • calcVolume

        public double calcVolume()
        This method calculates the volume of the sphere
        Returns:
        double of calculated volume

      • isPointInSphere

        public boolean isPointInSphere(double x,
                               double y)
        This method tests to see if a point is inside the sphere object and returns true if it is and false if the specified point is not within the sphere
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate of point
        y - y-coordinate of point
        Returns:
        true if point is inside sphere and false if not in sphere

      • grow

        public void grow(double factor)
        This method increases or decreases the radius of the sphere by a growth factor
        Parameters:
        factor - the double amount the sphere's radius will increase or decrease by

      • draw

        public void draw(processing.core.PApplet drawer)
        This method draws a new instance of a Sphere object
        Parameters:
        drawer - PApplet used to draw the sphere
        Precondition:
        drawer must not be null and appropriate settings should have been selected
